title: Sri Lanka imposes police curfew in Western province after violence
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has imposed police curfew from midnight Friday (01) to 6.00 am Saturday (02) in Western Province, police spokesman said, after a clash between hundreds of protesters and police led to arrest of at least 45 people.
Police Spokesman Ajith Rohana said police curfew will be in place in the Western province until 6.00am on Saturday.
Police used tear gas and water cannons late on Thursday to disperse hundreds of protesters who tried to enter President Gotabaya Rajapaksa’s Mirihana private residence.

The protesters had been demanding Rajapaksa to step down citing he has failed to address the ongoing economic crisis amid queues for fuel and cooking gas as well as nearly half a day power cut on a daily basis. (Colombo/April01/2022)
